text: Lucille Starr (May 13, 1938 â€“ September 4, 2020) was a Canadian country singer-songwriter, and yodeler. She was best known for her 1964 hit single, "Quand Le Soleil Dit Bonjour Aux Montagnes" ("The French Song"). Starr died in Las Vegas, Nevada on September 4, 2020 at the age of 82."Manitoba-born country music queen Lucille Starr dies at 82".
